1.text: Continuing in a similar manner, Eliu had this to say:

2.text: Bear with me for a little while and I will show you; for I have still more to say in favor of God.

3.text: I will review my knowledge from the beginning, and I will prove my Maker to be just.

4.text: For truly my words are without any falsehood and perfect knowledge will be proven to you.

5.text: God does not abandon the powerful, for he himself is also powerful.

6.text: But he does not save the impious, though he grants judgment to the poor.

7.text: He will not take his eyes away from the just, and he continually establishes kings on their throne, and they are exalted.

8.text: And, if they are in captivity, or are bound with the chains of poverty,

9.text: he will reveal to them their works, as well as their sinfulness, in that they were violent.

10.text: Likewise, he will open their ears to his correction, and he will speak to them, so that they may return from iniquity.

11.text: If they listen and obey, they will fill their days with goodness and complete their years in glory.

12.text: But if they will not listen, they will pass away by the sword and will be consumed by foolishness.

13.text: The false and the crafty provoke the wrath of God, yet they do not cry out to him when they are chained.

14.text: Their soul will die in a storm, and their life, among the unmanly.

15.text: He will rescue the poor from his anguish, and he will open his ear during tribulation.

16.text: Therefore, he will save you from the narrow mouth very widely, even though it has no foundation under it. Moreover, your respite at table will be full of fatness.

17.text: Your case has been judged like that of the impious; you will withdraw your plea and your judgment.

18.text: Therefore, do not let anger overwhelm you so that you oppress another; neither should you allow a multitude of gifts to influence you.

19.text: Lay down your greatness without distress, and put aside all of your power with courage.

20.text: Do not prolong the night, even if people rise on their behalf.

21.text: Be careful that you do not turn to iniquity; for, after your misery, you have begun to follow this.

22.text: Behold, God is exalted in his strength, and there is no one like him among the law-givers.

23.text: Who is able to investigate his ways? And who can say, “You have done iniquity,” to him?

24.text: Remember that you are ignorant of his work, yet men have sung its praises.

25.text: All men consider him; and each one ponders from a distance.

26.text: Behold, God is great, defeating our knowledge; the number of his years is inestimable.

27.text: He carries away the drops of rain, and he sends forth showers like a raging whirlpool;

28.text: they flow from the clouds that are woven above everything.

29.text: If he wills it, he extends the clouds as his tent

30.text: and shines with his light from above; likewise, he covers the oceans within his tent.

31.text: For he judges the people by these things, and he gives food to a multitude of mortals.

32.text: Within his hands, he hides the light, and he commands it to come forth again.

33.text: He announces it to his friend, for it is his possession and he is able to reach out to it.
